cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 135 miles south-southwest of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northeast toward Floridaâ€™s Big Bend, then forecast to sweep across Georgia and the Carolinas before curving offshore of the Mid-Atlantic coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast between Suwannee River and Mexico Beach

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Surf City NC to Oregon Inlet NC, including Pamlico Sound
weather_observation.warning_coast: Englewood FL to Suwannee River FL (tropical-storm); Suwannee River FL to Mexico Beach FL (hurricane)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf coast (Big Bend) eastward across Georgia and the Carolinas, then northward along the Mid-Atlantic coast
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: GFMX 280N 890W (northern Gulf, just east of Plaquemines)
weather_observation.wind: Only a very slight (<5%) chance of brief tropical-storm-force gusts; operational winds expected to remain below gale force.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant surge expected along Plaquemines coastline because the storm center and on-shore flow remain well east of the Mississippi Delta.
weather_observation.rainfall: Only scattered outer-band showers; widespread heavy rain is not anticipated.
weather_observation.other_hazards: None expected that would materially affect port operations.
